programme.title: Home Workout
programme.desc: High impact, high energy cardio workout based on Pilates moves

programme.title: Ted Talk
programme.sub-title: How to put the power of law in people's hands | Vivek Maru
programme.desc: What can you do when the wheels of justice don't turn fast enough? Or when they don't turn at all? Vivek Maru is working to transform the relationship between people and law, turning law from an abstraction or threat into something that everyone can understand, use and shape. Instead of relying solely on lawyers, Maru started a global network of community paralegals, or barefoot lawyers, who serve in their own communities and break the law down into simple terms to help people find solutions. Learn more about how this innovative approach to using the law is helping socially excluded people claim their rights. "A little bit of legal empowerment can go a long way," Maru says.

programme.title: Shamba Shape Up Series 1
Shamba Shape Up Series 1
programme.desc:
Today we’re in Bulika village in Mukono and we’re visiting farmer Olivia Kiwombeeka. A very hard-working lady and mother to 14 children. She has a 4-acre farm where she grows coffee, bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava, beans! And don’t forget the cows, the pigs, the goats, the chicken, the pigeons!!!
Where does she find the energy???
In this farm we are learning about:
1. Soil fertility and manure drying and soil testing 2. Pests and diseases control in Coffee plantation 3. Bananas: Good farming practices 4. Orange Fleshed Sweet Potatoes

Today we’re in Bulika village in Mukono and we’re visiting farmer Olivia Kiwombeeka. A very hard-working lady and mother to 14 children. She has a 4-acre farm where she grows coffee, bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava, beans! And don’t forget the cows, the pigs, the goats, the chicken, the pigeons!!!

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Johannesburg
programme.desc: A trip to Botswana is approaching, and Christall is under pressure to deliver on her promise. Naledi hosts her mother's 50th birthday party, but will it live up to everyone's expectations?

programme.title: Ted Talk
TEDTalk
programme.sub-title: The thrilling potential for off-grid solar energy | Amar Inamdar
The thrilling potential for off-grid solar energy | Amar Inamdar
programme.desc: There's an energy revolution happening in villages and towns across Africa -- off-grid solar energy is becoming a viable alternative to traditional electricity systems. In a bold talk about a true leapfrog moment, Amar Inamdar introduces us to proud owners of off-grid solar kits -- and explains how this technology has the opportunity to meet two extraordinary goals: energy access for all and a low-carbon future. "Every household a proud producer as well as consumer of energy," Inamdar says. "That's the democracy of energy." (Followed by a brief Q&A with TED Curator Chris Anderson)

There's an energy revolution happening in villages and towns across Africa -- off-grid solar energy is becoming a viable alternative to traditional electricity systems. In a bold talk about a true leapfrog moment, Amar Inamdar introduces us to proud owners of off-grid solar kits -- and explains how this technology has the opportunity to meet two extraordinary goals: energy access for all and a low-carbon future. "Every household a proud producer as well as consumer of energy," Inamdar says. "That's the democracy of energy." (Followed by a brief Q&A with TED Curator Chris Anderson)

programme.title: Congo: Jungle Fever | Deadliest Journeys
programme.desc: In South Kivu in Congo, the city of Shabunda is one of the most isolated in the country. Its access is so difficult that life is more expensive there than in any European city. Thus, the poorest families come to look for food there by bicycle or motorbike. These convicts of the road sometimes transport up to 250 kilos of goods for several days, without worrying about the dangers. Without ever giving up, these travelers are almost all considered heroes because "he who does not travel does not know the value of men", according to the Congolese.

programme.title: House of Commons
programme.sub-title: Harriett Baldwin MP, Minister of State (Foreign and Commonwealth Office) (Joint with the Department for International Development) (West Worcestershire, Conservative)
programme.desc: Harriett Baldwin MP, Minister of State (Foreign and Commonwealth Office) (Joint with the Department for International Development) (West Worcestershire, Conservative)

programme.title: I Am Ali
programme.desc: An intimate and heart-warming look at the man behind the legend - as we've never seen Ali before. Told through exclusive, unprecedented access to Ali's personal archive of 'audio journals' combined with touching interviews and testimonials from his inner circle of family and friends, including his daughters, son, brother and former wife, plus legends of the boxing community including Mike Tyson, George Foreman and Gene Kilroy.

programme.sub-title: Harriett Baldwin MP, Minister of State (Foreign and Commonwealth Office) (Joint with the Department for International Development) (West Worcestershire, Conservative)

programme.title: Ted Talk
programme.sub-title: How to put the power of law in people's hands | Vivek Maru
programme.desc: What can you do when the wheels of justice don't turn fast enough? Or when they don't turn at all? Vivek Maru is working to transform the relationship between people and law, turning law from an abstraction or threat into something that everyone can understand, use and shape. Instead of relying solely on lawyers, Maru started a global network of community paralegals, or barefoot lawyers, who serve in their own communities and break the law down into simple terms to help people find solutions. Learn more about how this innovative approach to using the law is helping socially excluded people claim their rights. "A little bit of legal empowerment can go a long way," Maru says.

programme.title: House of Lords
programme.desc: Lord Boateng

programme.title: Freely Expressed Wishes of the people of Southern Cameroons
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 0 - An introduction and a comparison of the Trust Territory of Southern Cameroons to the Trust Territory of French Cameroun at the end of 1959

programme.title: Freely Expressed Wishes of the people of Southern Cameroons
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 1 - A brief history of Southern Cameroons / Ambazonia from early 1900s to 1954, describing British and French mandate and trusteeship periods of administration under the League of Nations and the United Nations, the rise of a political class in the persons of Endeley, Mbile, Foncha, Muna, Kale and others, the journey as part of the Eastern Region of Nigeria to the creation of the first quasi-regional government of Southern Cameroons in Buea in 1954

programme.title: Freely Expressed Wishes of the people of Southern Cameroons
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 2 - Debunking the myth that Southern Cameroons was poor, this episode delves into the finances and statistics of the territory prior to the big debates on its future

programme.title: Freely Expressed Wishes of the people of Southern Cameroons
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 3 - The years 1954-1958 witness the maturity of the political landscape in Southern Cameroons as it prepared towards achieving the objectives of Article 76b of the UN Charter

programme.title: Freely Expressed Wishes of the people of Southern Cameroons
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 4 - 1959 marks a turning point in the history of the Cameroons, a year mired by gridlock at the UN and maneuvering by the Administering Authority (HMG / UK) to protect its interests

programme.title: Freely Expressed Wishes of the people of Southern Cameroons
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 5 - Southern Cameroons does soul-searching for the 'two' questions that they must present at the 14th session of the UN General Assembly, but ultimately, the wishes of the people are trumped by a maneuver that puts the territory on a perilous path.

Music
programme.desc: Music
African Music

programme.title: Faces Of Africa - Samora Machel: The Struggle Continues
programme.sub-title: Faces Of Africa - Samora Machel: The Struggle Continues
programme.desc: A President, a military commander, revolutionary socialist and a member of Frelimo soldiers, Samora Machel from Mozambique. Faces of Africa takes you through his battles and struggles in life.

programme.desc: America's Funniest Home Videos

African Music

programme.title: Heartbeat Episode 9
programme.desc: Rüzgar goes to Bosnia after losing the woman he loves in a car crash two years ago, to run away from everything and everyone but mostly his memories.. He doesn’t make contact with anyone for two years, including his family. His uncle Kemaç and his mother Vahide who is the owner of a major corporation in Turkey, find Ruzgar after long efforts. So Kemal goes to Bosnia to bring Rüzgar back. But Rüzgar is still heartbroken. He can’t live like this so he runs away after a family dinner without telling anyone. He finds himself in Foça after meeting with a taxi driver. Meanwhile Zeynep is about to marry her childhood love Kutay. There’s only a week until the wedding, while the preparations continue Zeynep learns that she was cheated on. She goes to Foça to her most dear grandpa Muammer and aunt Ayla. However, she faints just before she could get there, right in front of Rüzgar’s house. She hides her true identity from everyone except Rüzgar. Afterwards, Zeynep is forced to see Kutay as her best friend Hande is getting married. Sibel, Başak and Hande think up a plan. But they need Rüzgar to make this plan work. Rüzgar can’t say no to this after hearing what happened to Zeynep. So a game of hearts begins between Zeynep and Rüzgar.
